highlights: Wrote programs to query APIs (e.g. World Bank's World Development Indicators) and collect and save data for local processing
Wrote a program to periodically update over 100 graphs, choropleth maps, and slides with new data from API queries automatically

Documented code by adding comments and docstrings, flaggged outdated code, added features to enhance functionality of previously written code, organized input and output files by name and date, updated pointers and references throughout project files
Translated projects with over 10k lines of code from one language to another (e.g. from Python to R and Stata)
Collected and cleaned over 2 decades of census data with dozens of variables
Wrote reports and updated a task management system to ensure timely delivery of results
Cleaned, processed and analyzed large-scale datasets with over 10 million observations and 10,000 variables, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Developed and implemented programs to estimate target parameters using five different estimators in a High-Performance Computing (HPC) environment.
Assisted in the preparation of lecture notes by writing summaries of paper,
Produced histograms to help visualize student performance across tests, assignments, and quizzes
Graded and returned tests, quizzes, and homeworks (almost always) within 2 days
Held office hours to discuss student queries
Held lectures and remedial classes with over 30 students
Helped compile lecture notes for distribution using programs like R/Sweve and LaTeX
Wrote web-scrapers to compile 1000+ data points for in-class use
Collected novel survey data for analysis (e.g. by establishing connections with the Bureau of Labor Statistics)
Processed data for experimental research design (e.g. Diff-in-diff, )

Employed variable selection methods (e.g., Lasso, Ridge, Stepwise Regression) to identify the most relevant variables out of a dataset with over 1000 variables, improving model accuracy and interpretability.
Combined disparate data sets to produce choropleth maps, animations, tables, and time serires plots
Designed and conducted causal inference techniques to uncover the impact of various policies (e.g. my work shows a 1% increase in minimum wages leads to a 0.44% increase in reservation wages)
Presented findings through detailed reports and visualizations to inform decision-making and policy development.
Utilized statistical software (e.g., R, Stata) to conduct rigorous econometric analyses and derive actionable insights.
Conducted replication studies by deploying national economic models at the state level, ensuring methodological consistency and accuracy across different scales.
Assist with publicity and outreach via social networking services (e.g. LinkedIn)
Compiled market research by scraping online resources into Excel data for marketing teams
Compiled and presented reports for disseminating actionable insights

projects.name: Effects of minimum wage reform on reservation wages
projects.description: Used quasi experimental designs (stacked event study designs, triple diff designs, etc) to show a 1% increase in minimumw wages lead to a 0.44-0.57% increase in reservation wages (the lowest wages a worker will accept)

projects.name: Effects of unemployment insurance generosity on unemployment
projects.description: Replication of Gallant et. al 2020, in which I translated their Stata code into R, implemented their model at the state level, and showed that terminating enhanced unemployment insurance early led to a 5% fall in unemployment

awards.title: Marty Weinbaum Outstanding Academic Achievement Award
awards.summary: Given to a student with the highest overall GPA
